text: Psalm 50
An Oracle Concerning Sacrifices
A psalm of Asaph.\f + \fr Ps 50 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
The Supreme God, God, Yahweh, has spoken
and summoned \add the\add* earth,
from \add the\add* rising of \add the\add* sun
to its setting.
From Zion, \add the\add* perfection of beauty,
God shines forth.
Our God comes and he is not silent.
Before him fire devours,
and around him it is very tempestuous.
He summons the heavens above
and the earth that he might judge his people:
“Gather to me my loyal ones,
\add those\add* who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
And \add the\add* heavens declare his righteousness,
because God himself is judge. \qs Selah\qs*
“Hear, O my people, and I will speak,
O Israel, and I will testify against you.
I am God, your God.
It is not concerning \add a lack of\add* your sacrifices \add that\add* I rebuke you,
and your burnt offerings \add are\add* before me continually.
I will not take from your house a bull
\add or\add* from your stalls a he-goat,
because every animal of the forest is mine,
\add the\add* cattle on a thousand hills.
I know every bird of \add the\add* mountains,
and \add every\add* moving creature in \add the\add* field \add is\add* mine.
If I were hungry I would not tell you,
because \add the\add* world and its fullness \add are\add* mine.
Do I eat \add the\add* flesh of bulls
or drink \add the\add* blood of goats?
Offer to God a thank offering
and pay your vows to \add the\add* Most High.
And call me in \add the\add* day of trouble;
I will deliver you, and you will glorify me.”
But to the wicked God says,
“What \add right\add* have you to recite my statutes
and ⸤mention my covenant with your mouth⸥,\f + \fr 50:16 \ft Literally “take my covenant on your mouth” \f*
while you yourself hate discipline,
and cast my words behind you?
When you see a thief, then you are pleased with him,
and your association \add is\add* with adulterers.
You give your mouth free rein for evil,
and you harness your tongue to deceit.
You sit and speak against your brother;
you slander your mother’s son.
These \add things\add* you have done, and I have been silent;
You imagined that I was just like you.
I will rebuke you and present \add an argument\add* before your eyes.
Now consider this, you who forget God,
lest I tear \add you\add* apart, and there \add will be\add* none to deliver.
He who sacrifices a thank offering honors me,
and he \add who\add* orders \add his\add* way;
I will show him the salvation of God.”
